document.discussion_title: Natural gas line project shifts to downtown Bend
document.topic_text: Natural gas line project shifts to downtown Bend Work to begin on Idaho, Louisiana avenues From KTVZ.COM news sources Large Text BEND, Ore. - Cascade Natural Gas crews working on the Bend Westside Replacement Project will begin replacing gas lines in the downtown area Monday, officials said. More From KTVZ.COM Two injury crashes tie up Bend-area traffic Look for CNG crews working in the area of Northeast Idaho Avenue and Bond Street, moving east. Northwest Idaho Avenue will be closed to through traffic while main installation takes place. Bond Street will have the right lane closed and parking on the right side of the street closed during main construction. A separate crew will also be working on Northwest Louisiana Avenue, and flaggers will be redirecting traffic. Motorists should avoid these streets during construction, but the streets will reopen at 6 p.m. each evening. Copyright 2016 KTVZ . All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed Recommended
